answers.answer: Your levels look like Hypothyroidism to me.Ask your Doctor to run antibody testing on your thyroid for Hashi's.If found that you have Hashimotos Autoimmune Disease, you will be on meds for life.Usually the Doc will start you off on a T4 med like Synthroid and then re-evaluate you 4-6 weeks later with new labs.If your labs show no antibodies then it may be thyroiditis and you will be on the T4 med until your levels stabilise.

Your FT4 looks normal on paper, but it is NOT normal. Your TSH is high, and your FT4 is about to fall off the 'normal' map. To put this in perspective, my TSH is only 2.74. My FT4 is a 0.8. My Anti-TPO (hashi antibody) is a 221 -anything over 35 indicates Hashi.Get the following tests:thyroid ultrasoundBloodwork (it is good to repeat the TSH and FT4):TSHFT4FT3Anti-TPO (Hashi)TGab (Hashi)Take care...:) Tamra
Also, request to see an endocrinologist who specializes in thyroid - NOT JUST DIABETES.:) Tamra

question: HiI recently started having severe hair fall and my dermatologist sugested taking a thyroid test. My TSH is 7.18 uIU/ml , normal value accoring to lab [0.49 to 4.67 uIU/ml] and SERUM FREE T4 is 0.84 ng/dl normal alue according to lab is [0.8 to 4.67 uIU/ml].I do not have any other symptoms . What are the medications I must take and how severe is my thyroid problem.How long should i be on medication and what are the other things I should take care of.Thansk for your reply.Gayathri.
title: TSH high Free T4 normal
